content: Before you delete the space, please make sure that automatic billing is turned off. You may check the status of automatic billing in <1>your Stripe customer portal</1>.

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message reminding users to turn off automatic billing before deleting their portal. The message appears in a dialog box when the user attempts to delete their space.

usage.context:
>
 <ModalDialog.Header>
 {t("DeletePortal", { productName: t("Common:ProductName") })}
 </ModalDialog.Header>
 <ModalDialog.Body>
 <Trans t={t} i18nKey="DeletePortalInfo" ns="Settings">
 Before you delete the portal, please make sure that automatic billing
 is turned off. You may check the status of automatic billing in
 <Link
 className="stripe-url-link"
 tag="a"

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The `<1>` tags are inconsistent. The opening tag uses `</1>` while the closing tag uses `<1>`. This is a formatting error that will likely cause issues with rendering.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent formatting of tags. Both opening and closing tags should be `<1>` and `</1>` respectively.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags (<1>...</1>) are present in both the English and Azerbaijani text, which is correct, but signifies that this element should be emphasized or linked.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure that the hyperlink functionality is correctly implemented in the Azerbaijani version when displaying the text.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag <1> is inconsistent with the English version. It should be closed correctly.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the HTML tag is properly closed: `<1>Stripe портала за клиенти.</1> should be `<1>Stripe портала за клиенти</1>`

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is present in both the English and Czech text, but it's crucial to ensure consistency in how these tags are handled within the application displaying the translated text. While not inherently incorrect, it's important to verify if this formatting is intended and implemented correctly within the platform.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify if the `<1>` tag is used consistently in the application and its purpose is clear. Consider standardizing HTML tag usage.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "your Stripe customer portal" is translated as "Πύλη πελατών Stripe." While technically correct, a more natural and user-friendly translation would be something like "ο λογαριασμός σας στην Stripe" or "ο λογαριασμός σας στο Stripe". The current translation sounds very formal and might not be easily understood by the average user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Πύλη πελατών Stripe -> ο λογαριασμός σας στην Stripe

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting tags (<1>...</1>) are preserved in the Greek translation, which is not ideal. These should ideally be removed or adapted to match Greek formatting conventions.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the <1> tags entirely or adapt them to match Greek HTML/formatting conventions.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is not properly closed. It is opened before "votre portail client Stripe" and should be closed after.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Avant de supprimer l’espace, veuillez vous assurer que la facturation automatique est désactivée. Vous pouvez vérifier le statut de la facturation automatique dans <1> votre portail client Stripe </1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` are inconsistent with the English content's use of tags. It would be more consistent to use `<1>` tags in the Italian translation as well.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage. Verify that tags match the original English content.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is not properly closed or equivalent in Korean formatting. The English content uses `<1>your Stripe customer portal</1>` and the Korean translation has `<1>Stripe 고객 포털</1>`. While the content is accurate, the HTML tag representation is different and should be consistent for display purposes.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage. Consider replacing `<1>` with a system-specific equivalent or adjusting the rendering to handle the Korean HTML differently.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase "ອອກ​ໃບ​ບິນ​ອັດ​ຕະ​ໂນ​ມັດ" (ok lai bin attathommat) is a literal translation of "automatic billing" and might not be the most natural way to express it in Lao. A more common phrasing could be "ການ​ຈ່າຍ​ອັດ​ຕະ​ໂນ​ມັດ" (kan jay attathommat) which means "automatic payment".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider replacing "ອອກ​ໃບ​ບິນ​ອັດ​ຕະ​ໂນ​ມັດ" with "ການ​ຈ່າຍ​ອັດ​ຕະ​ໂນ​ມັດ".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term "ແຜງບໍລິານ​ລູກ​ຄ້າ Stripe ຂອງ​ທ່ານ" (phaeng borihan luk kha Stripe khong than) is a direct translation of "Stripe customer portal". While understandable, "ໜ້າທ່ຽວ​ຂອງລູກ​ຄ້າ Stripe” (na thiao khong luk kha Stripe) which translates to “Stripe customer page” might be more intuitive for some users.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider replacing “ແຜງບໍລິານ​ລູກ​ຄ້າ Stripe ຂອງ​ທ່ານ” with “ໜ້າທ່ຽວ​ຂອງລູກ​ຄ້າ Stripe”.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting of the link tag is inconsistent. The English uses 'your Stripe customer portal', while the Latvian only uses 'Stripe klientu portālā'. The 'your' is missing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Pirms izdzēst telpu, pārliecinieties, vai automātiska norēķināšanās ir izslēgta. Automātisko norēķinu statusu varat pārbaudīt <1>jūsu Stripe klientu portālā</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag <1> is inconsistent with the English source.  The English uses 'your' before Stripe customer portal, implying personalization.  The Polish translation lacks this personalization, so the HTML tag should not wrap the entire phrase.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the HTML tag around 'portalu klienta Stripe'. The suggested translation would be: "Zanim usuniesz obszar, upewnij się, że automatyczne fakturowanie jest wyłączone. Status automatycznego fakturowania sprawdzisz w portalu klienta Stripe."

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is inconsistently used. The English content uses `your Stripe customer portal` while the Portuguese uses `seu portal do cliente Stripe`. While semantically similar, the structure is different. It's best to maintain consistency.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the formatting tags consistently surround the same content and style, or consider using a different markup style.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The formatting of the hyperlink in the Romanian translation is inconsistent with the English. The English uses `<1>...</1>`, while the Romanian uses `portalul dvs de client Stripe`. A more consistent approach is needed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Use the same formatting tags as the English version: `<1>portalul dvs. de client Stripe</1>`.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'portalul dvs de client Stripe' is understandable, a more natural Romanian translation for 'your Stripe customer portal' would be 'portalul tău de client Stripe'.  'Dvs.' is formal and less common in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change 'portalul dvs de client Stripe' to 'portalul tău de client Stripe'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'удалением портала' (deletion of portal) is awkward in this context. The English refers to 'space,' while the Russian uses 'портала' which translates more literally to 'portal.' This creates a mismatch. 'Пространства' would be a more accurate translation of 'space'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Перед удалением пространства, пожалуйста, убедитесь, что автоматическое выставление счетов отключено.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'на вашем портале клиента Stripe' is too literal and sounds unnatural in Russian. A more natural phrasing would be 'в вашем личном кабинете Stripe'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: В вашем личном кабинете Stripe

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is inconsistently used. The English uses it to highlight the link, and the Sinhala translation also uses it, but it's important to maintain consistency with the original formatting conventions.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent use of HTML tags to mirror the source content's formatting.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ඔබගේ ස්ට්‍රයිප් පාරිභෝගික ද්වාරය' (obage strip paribhogika dvaraya) translates literally to 'your Stripe customer door'. While understandable, a more natural phrasing in Sinhala would be something like 'ඔබේ ස්ට්‍රයිප් ගාස්තුවක් ගණනය කිරීමේ පෝරුව' (obey strip gasthawak gananaya karimata poruwa), which means 'your Stripe billing portal'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider rephrasing 'ඔබගේ ස්ට්‍රයිප් පාරිභෝගික ද්වාරය' to 'ඔබේ ස්ට්‍රයිප් ගාස්තුවක් ගණනය කිරීමේ පෝරුව' for a more natural and idiomatic translation.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent. The English uses 'your Stripe customer portal' while the Slovenian uses 'vašem portalu za stranke Stripe'. The formatting should reflect this difference.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Change the Slovenian translation's HTML tags to properly enclose the linked text 'vašem portalu za stranke Stripe'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tag `<1>` is not consistently applied. It's used for the link but not the surrounding text.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent formatting of the link using `<1>` and `</1>` around the entire phrase 'vašem Stripe korisničkom portalu'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Ukrainian translation's tag `<1>` does not match the English tag. The English tag reads `your Stripe customer portal`, while the Ukrainian tag reads `клієнтському порталі Stripe.`. The possessive 'your' is lost in translation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider revising the Ukrainian tag to accurately reflect the English tag's possessive element. For example, `<1>вашому клієнтському порталі Stripe</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The angle brackets `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent with the English content. The English uses `your Stripe customer portal`, while the Vietnamese uses 'cổng thông tin khách hàng Stripe của mình'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Adjust the formatting to match the Vietnamese phrasing, potentially using a different highlighting or linking method if needed, or remove the tags if they're purely for internal formatting.
